paragraphs.content: Chapter 30
paragraphs.contentHtml: Chapter 30

paragraphs.content: The word that came to Jeremiah from the LORD, saying,
paragraphs.contentHtml: The word that came to Jeremiah from the Lord, saying,

paragraphs.content: Thus speaketh the LORD God of Israel, saying, Write thee all the words that I have spoken unto thee in a book.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Thus speaketh the Lord God of Israel, saying, Write thee all the words that I have spoken unto thee in a book.

paragraphs.content: For, lo, the days come, saith the LORD, that I will bring again the captivity of my people Israel and Judah, saith the LORD: and I will cause them to return to the land that I gave to their fathers, and they shall possess it.
paragraphs.contentHtml: For, lo, the days come, saith the Lord, that I will bring again the captivity of my people Israel and Judah, saith the Lord: and I will cause them to return to the land that I gave to their fathers, and they shall possess it.

paragraphs.content: ¶ And these are the words that the LORD spake concerning Israel and concerning Judah.
paragraphs.contentHtml: ¶ And these are the words that the Lord spake concerning Israel and concerning Judah.

paragraphs.content: For thus saith the LORD; We have heard a voice of trembling, of fear, and not of peace.
paragraphs.contentHtml: For thus saith the Lord; We have heard a voice of trembling, of fear, and not of peace.

paragraphs.content: Ask ye now, and see whether a man doth travail with child? wherefore do I see every man with his hands on his loins, as a woman in travail, and all faces are turned into paleness?
paragraphs.contentHtml: Ask ye now, and see whether a man doth travail with child? wherefore do I see every man with his hands on his loins, as a woman in travail, and all faces are turned into paleness?

paragraphs.content: Alas! for that day is great, so that none is like it: it is even the time of Jacob’s trouble; but he shall be saved out of it.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Alas! for that day is great, so that none is like it: it is even the time of Jacob’s trouble; but he shall be saved out of it.

paragraphs.content: For it shall come to pass in that day, saith the LORD of hosts, that I will break his yoke from off thy neck, and will burst thy bonds, and strangers shall no more serve themselves of him:
paragraphs.contentHtml: For it shall come to pass in that day, saith the Lord of hosts, that I will break his yoke from off thy neck, and will burst thy bonds, and strangers shall no more serve themselves of him:

paragraphs.content: But they shall serve the LORD their God, and David their king, whom I will raise up unto them.
paragraphs.contentHtml: But they shall serve the Lord their God, and David their king, whom I will raise up unto them.

paragraphs.content: ¶ Therefore fear thou not, O my servant Jacob, saith the LORD; neither be dismayed, O Israel: for, lo, I will save thee from afar, and thy seed from the land of their captivity; and Jacob shall return, and shall be in rest, and be quiet, and none shall make him afraid.
paragraphs.contentHtml: ¶ Therefore fear thou not, O my servant Jacob, saith the Lord; neither be dismayed, O Israel: for, lo, I will save thee from afar, and thy seed from the land of their captivity; and Jacob shall return, and shall be in rest, and be quiet, and none shall make him afraid.

paragraphs.content: For I am with thee, saith the LORD, to save thee: though I make a full end of all nations whither I have scattered thee, yet will I not make a full end of thee: but I will correct thee in measure, and will not leave thee altogether unpunished.
paragraphs.contentHtml: For I am with thee, saith the Lord, to save thee: though I make a full end of all nations whither I have scattered thee, yet will I not make a full end of thee: but I will correct thee in measure, and will not leave thee altogether unpunished.

paragraphs.content: For thus saith the LORD, Thy bruise is incurable, and thy wound is grievous.
paragraphs.contentHtml: For thus saith the Lord, Thy bruise is incurable, and thy wound is grievous.

paragraphs.content: There is none to plead thy cause, that thou mayest be bound up: thou hast no healing medicines.
paragraphs.contentHtml: There is none to plead thy cause, that thou mayest be bound up: thou hast no healing medicines.

paragraphs.content: All thy lovers have forgotten thee; they seek thee not; for I have wounded thee with the wound of an enemy, with the chastisement of a cruel one, for the multitude of thine iniquity; because thy sins were increased.
paragraphs.contentHtml: All thy lovers have forgotten thee; they seek thee not; for I have wounded thee with the wound of an enemy, with the chastisement of a cruel one, for the multitude of thine iniquity; because thy sins were increased.

paragraphs.content: Why criest thou for thine affliction? thy sorrow is incurable for the multitude of thine iniquity: because thy sins were increased, I have done these things unto thee.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Why criest thou for thine affliction? thy sorrow is incurable for the multitude of thine iniquity: because thy sins were increased, I have done these things unto thee.

paragraphs.content: Therefore all they that devour thee shall be devoured; and all thine adversaries, every one of them, shall go into captivity; and they that spoil thee shall be a spoil, and all that prey upon thee will I give for a prey.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Therefore all they that devour thee shall be devoured; and all thine adversaries, every one of them, shall go into captivity; and they that spoil thee shall be a spoil, and all that prey upon thee will I give for a prey.

paragraphs.content: For I will restore health unto thee, and I will heal thee of thy wounds, saith the LORD; because they called thee an Outcast, saying, This is Zion, whom no man seeketh after.
paragraphs.contentHtml: For I will restore health unto thee, and I will heal thee of thy wounds, saith the Lord; because they called thee an Outcast, saying, This is Zion, whom no man seeketh after.

paragraphs.content: ¶ Thus saith the LORD; Behold, I will bring again the captivity of Jacob’s tents, and have mercy on his dwellingplaces; and the city shall be builded upon her own heap, and the palace shall remain after the manner thereof.
paragraphs.contentHtml: ¶ Thus saith the Lord; Behold, I will bring again the captivity of Jacob’s tents, and have mercy on his dwellingplaces; and the city shall be builded upon her own heap, and the palace shall remain after the manner thereof.

paragraphs.content: And out of them shall proceed thanksgiving and the voice of them that make merry: and I will multiply them, and they shall not be few; I will also glorify them, and they shall not be small.
paragraphs.contentHtml: And out of them shall proceed thanksgiving and the voice of them that make merry: and I will multiply them, and they shall not be few; I will also glorify them, and they shall not be small.

paragraphs.content: Their children also shall be as aforetime, and their congregation shall be established before me, and I will punish all that oppress them.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Their children also shall be as aforetime, and their congregation shall be established before me, and I will punish all that oppress them.

paragraphs.content: And their nobles shall be of themselves, and their governor shall proceed from the midst of them; and I will cause him to draw near, and he shall approach unto me: for who is this that engaged his heart to approach unto me? saith the LORD.
paragraphs.contentHtml: And their nobles shall be of themselves, and their governor shall proceed from the midst of them; and I will cause him to draw near, and he shall approach unto me: for who is this that engaged his heart to approach unto me? saith the Lord.

paragraphs.content: And ye shall be my people, and I will be your God.
paragraphs.contentHtml: And ye shall be my people, and I will be your God.

paragraphs.content: Behold, the whirlwind of the LORD goeth forth with fury, a continuing whirlwind: it shall fall with pain upon the head of the wicked.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Behold, the whirlwind of the Lord goeth forth with fury, a continuing whirlwind: it shall fall with pain upon the head of the wicked.

paragraphs.content: The fierce anger of the LORD shall not return, until he have done it, and until he have performed the intents of his heart: in the latter days ye shall consider it.
paragraphs.contentHtml: The fierce anger of the Lord shall not return, until he have done it, and until he have performed the intents of his heart: in the latter days ye shall consider it.
